function_names.name: Power
function_names.detailed_description:
These are the CM4's power input and output pins:
  • 6 x 5V input pins
  • 2 x 1.8V Output pins
  • 2 x 3.3V Output pins
  • GPIO_VREF, which controls whether the GPIO pins operate at 3v3 or 1v8

function_names.name: System
function_names.detailed_description:
These are pins for controlling and monitoring the Raspberry Pi system.
  • Wifi and Bluetooth disable pins
  • Power and actvity output LEDs
  • Reset and shutdown pins
  • Many more

function_names.name: GPIO
function_names.detailed_description: Pins that can be used as digital inputs or outputs as needed. See the Raspberry Pi documentation

function_names.name: GPCLK
function_names.detailed_description: Can be configured to output a fixed frequency on a pin. There's not much documentation on this, but pinout.xyz has an introduction

function_names.name: SPI
function_names.detailed_description: SPI Controller. The CM4 has 7 SPI controllers, details are on the Raspberry Pi documentation

function_names.name: SDIO
function_names.detailed_description: Used to connect the CM4 Lite to an SD Card.  If not using a CM4 Lite, this is used for the onboard eMMC, and shouldn't be used.

function_names.name: USB
function_names.detailed_description: Hardware USB controller. Details are available on the Raspberry Pi documentation

function_names.name: JTAG
function_names.detailed_description: Protocol for external programming and debugging and testing

function_names.name: TV
function_names.detailed_description: Analogue TV Video Output, commonly used with RCA / Phono / Composite connectors.

function_names.name: DPI
function_names.detailed_description: Parallel interface for controlling LCD displays. See the Raspberry Pi documentation

function_names.name: DSI
function_names.detailed_description: Serial interface for controlling LCD displays (like the official Touch display).

pins.name: Ethernet_nLED3
pins.description: Low Active Ethernet Activity indicator ( 3.3V signal) Typically a Green LED is connected to this pin: IOL = 8mA @ VOL< 0.4V

pins.name: Ethernet_SYNC_IN
pins.description: IEEE1588 SYNC Input pin ( 1.8V signal : IOL = 8mA @ VOL< 0.4V )

pins.name: Ethernet_nLED2
pins.description: Low Active Ethernet Activity indicator ( 3.3V signal) Typically a Green LED is connected to this pin: IOL = 8mA @ VOL< 0.4V

pins.name: Ethernet_SYNC_OUT
pins.description: IEEE1588 SYNC Output pin ( 1.8V signal : IOL = 8mA @ VOL< 0.4V )

pins.name: Ethernet_nLED1
pins.description: Low Active Ethernet speed indicator ( 3.3V signal) Typically a Yellow LED is connected to this pin. A low State indicates the 1Gbit or 10Mbit Link : IOL = 8mA @ VOL< 0.4V

pins.name: EEPROM_nWP
pins.description: Leaving floating NB internally pulled up to CM4_3.3V via 100K ( VIL <0.8V) but can be grounded to prevent writing to the on board EEPROM which stores the bootcode

pins.name: Pi_nLED_Activity
pins.description: Low Active Pi Activity LED. 20mA Max 5V tolerant ( VOL<0.4V). ( this is the signal that drives the Green LED on the Raspberry Pi 4 Model B )

pins.name: GPIO26
pins.description: GPIO Typically a 3.3V signal but can be a 1.8V signal by connecting GPIO_Vref to 1.8V.  Internal pull-down

pins.name: SD_CLK
pins.description: SDCARD Clock signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: GPIO2
pins.description: GPIO Typically a 3.3V signal but can be a 1.8V signal by connecting GPIO_Vref to 1.8V.  Internal pull-up

pins.name: SD_DAT3
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data3 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_CMD
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Command signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT0
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data0 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT5
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data5 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT1
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data1 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT4
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data4 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT2
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data2 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT7
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data7 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_DAT6
pins.description: SDCARD/eMMC Data6 signal (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: SD_VDD_Override
pins.description: Force SDCARD/eMMC interface to 1.8V signalling if set to 3.3V, otherwise leave unconnected. Typically only used if external eMMC is connected

pins.name: SD_PWR_ON
pins.description: Output to Power switch for the SDCARD. The CM4 sets this pin High (3.3V) to signal that Power to the SDCARD should be turned on. If booting from the SDCARD is required then a pullup should also be fitted so the power defaults to on. (only available on CM4Lite)

pins.name: GPIO_VREF
pins.description: Must be connected to CM4_3.3V (pins 84 and 86) for 3.3V GPIO or CM4_1.8V (pins 88 and 90) for 1.8V GPIO. This pin cannot be floating or connected to ground

pins.name: SCL0
pins.description: IIC Clock pin ( BCM2711 GPIO45) Typically used for Camera and Display Internal 1.8K pull up to CM4_3.3V

pins.name: SDA0
pins.description: IIC Data pin ( BCM2711 GPIO44) Typically used for Camera and Display Internal 1.8K pull up to CM4_3.3V

pins.name: CM4_3.3V (Output)
pins.description: 3.3V +/-2.5% Power Output max 300mA per pin for a total of 600mA. This will be powered down during power off or GLOBAL_EN being set low

pins.name: CM4_3.3V (Output)
pins.description: 3.3V +/-2.5% Power Output max 300mA per pin for a total of 600mA. This will be powered down during power off or GLOBAL_EN being set low

pins.name: CM4_1.8V (Output)
pins.description: 1.8V +/-2.5% Power Output max 300mA per pin for a total of 600mA. This will be powered down during power off or GLOBAL_EN being set low

pins.name: WL_nDisable
pins.description: Can be left floating.  If driven low the wireless interface will be disabled. Internal pulled up via 1.8K to CM4_3.3V

pins.name: CM4_1.8V (Output)
pins.description: 1.8V +/-2.5% Power Output max 300mA per pin for a total of 600mA. This will be powered down during power off or GLOBAL_EN being set low

pins.name: BT_nDisable
pins.description: Can be left floating.  If driven low the Bluetooth interface will be disabled. Internal pulled up via 1.8K to CM4_3.3V

pins.name: RUN_PG
pins.description: Bidirectional pin. Can be driven low ( via a 220R resistor) to Reset the CM4 CPU. As an Output a high signals Power Good and CPU running. Internally pulled up to +3.3V via 10K

pins.name: nRPIBOOT
pins.description: A low on this pin forces booting from an RPI server ( e.g. PC or a Raspberry Pi)  if not used leave floating. Internally pulled up via 10K to +3.3V

pins.name: AnalogIP1
pins.description: Analogue input of the MXL7704. Typically connected to CC pin of Type C power connector

pins.name: PI_LED_nPWR
pins.description: Low active Output to drive Power On LED. This signal needs to be buffered.

pins.name: AnalogIP0
pins.description: Analogue input of the MXL7704. Typically connected to CC pin of Type C power connector

pins.name: Camera_GPIO
pins.description: Typically used to Shutdown the camera to reduce power. Reassigning this pin to another function isn't recommended. CM4_3.3V signalling

pins.name: GLOBAL_EN
pins.description: Input. Drive low to power off CM4. Internally pulled up with a 100K to +5V

pins.name: nEXTRST
pins.description: Output Driven low during reset Driven high (CM4_3.3V) once CM4 CPU has started to boot

pins.name: USB_OTG_ID
pins.description: Input ( 3.3V signal ) USB OTG Pin. Internal pulled up. When grounded the CM4 becomes a USB host but the correct OS driver also needs to be used

pins.name: PCIe_CLK_nREQ
pins.description: Input (3.3V signal) PCIe Clock request pin (lock to request PCI clock).  Internal pulled up

pins.name: PCIe_nRST
pins.description: Output (+3.3V signal) PCIe Reset Low active

pins.name: PCIe_CLK_P
pins.description: PCIe Clock Out Positive (100MHz) NB AC coupling Capacitor Included on CM4

pins.name: PCIe_CLK_N
pins.description: PCIe Clock Out Negative (100MHz) NB AC coupling Capacitor Included on CM4

pins.name: PCIe_RX_P
pins.description: Input PCIe GEN 2 RX Positive NB External AC coupling Capacitor required

pins.name: PCIe_RX_N
pins.description: Input PCIe GEN 2 RX Negative NB External AC coupling Capacitor required

pins.name: PCIe_TX_P
pins.description: Output PCIe GEN 2 TX Positive NB AC coupling Capacitor Included on CM4

pins.name: PCIe_TX_N
pins.description: Output PCIe GEN 2 TX Negative NB AC coupling Capacitor Included on CM4

pins.name: HDMI1_HOTPLUG
pins.description: Input HDMI1 Hotplug Internally pulled down with a 100K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI1_SDA
pins.description: Bidir HDMI1 SDA Internally pulled up with a 1.8K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI1_SCL
pins.description: Bidir HDMI1 SCL Internally pulled up with a 1.8K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI1_CEC
pins.description: Input HDMI1 CEC Internally pulled up with a 27K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI0_CEC
pins.description: Input HDMI0 CEC Internally pulled up with a 27K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI0_HOTPLUG
pins.description: Input HDMI0 Hotplug Internally pulled down with a 100K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI0_SDA
pins.description: Bidir HDMI0 SDA Internally pulled up with a 1.8K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)

pins.name: HDMI0_SCL
pins.description: Bidir HDMI0 SCL Internally pulled up with a 1.8K. 5V tolerant. (It can be connected directly to a HDMI connector a small amount of ESD protection is provided on the CM4 by an on board HDMI05-CL02F3)
